reviews.title: Tasteful surprise!
reviews.text:
We chose the 4 course surprise menu and were also surprised by the food.
Tasteful and beautifully presented dishes. Fish (pollak) was not overcooked and tasted good. The corn chicken was also tender and not dry. Friendly service, who also chatted.
We will definitely be back! (Also because our little dog was welcome.)

reviews.title: Dinner in Harlingen
reviews.text:
We've been for dinner. The very nice and cozy place in Harlingen. We ate it fine, although paella was a bit too salty and the rice was too boiling. 
Mackerel tartare was delicious!

reviews.title: A lovely gastronomic experience
reviews.text: Very well cooked and presented food. Excellent maitre’d. Price quite disproportionate to quality.  Would recommend without hesitation.

reviews.title: Surprisingly good
reviews.text:
In addition to two nights, we also enjoyed a three-course dinner. What a fantastic experience. Excellent card but also good quality.
The service is friendly and extremely attentive
The food was fantastic.
This is truly recommended.

reviews.title: An evening meal with many points of interest
reviews.text: Because we spend the night in the associated hotel, we usually choose to have our evening meal in the hotel restaurant, especially after the corona era. After sitting down at the table, we ordered an aperitif and the restaurant attendant on duty handed us the dinner menu. We chose 2 different fish dishes there and something to share in advance. In our opinion, what is described on the menu should also be fulfilled on the plate and that was unfortunately not the case for a fish restaurant. In any case, a number of ingredients were missing. With the other fish dish, everything described on the menu seemed to be present, but the bunch of herbs with which this fish dish was prepared was still all the fish sloppily cooked in the oven. By the way, the presentation of the meals on the plates could really be much better. Both fish dishes were not really warm anymore, possibly had been left in the kitchen too long to serve, etc. In short, we approached the staff on duty and informed them that we were very dissatisfied with one fish restaurant, which was not prepared and served in accordance with the ingredients on the menu, etc. The other fish restaurant, we kept our assessment behind us. The staff on duty apologized profusely, we understood that, but I believe that if a restaurant kitchen cannot deliver what is on the menu, or if they want to make changes to the ordered dish, then I will deal with the moves most urgently to the customer to communicate certain things, which may possibly lead to another dish or the like. This communication only took place afterwards. The attendant on duty has chosen value for money by applying a discount on the food consumed. It does not alter the fact that this restaurant should consider a different menu that the kitchen staff can create. In short, a very mediocre assessment is unfortunately the result.

reviews.title: Very tasty and inexpensive
reviews.text: Very tasty, good selection of dishes. Very good value for money, very friendly staff, chef immediately accommodates special requests.

reviews.title: Excellent restaurant in the hotel where we stayed.
reviews.text: Nicely varied menus for luncheon or dinner, including delicious soups.  We enjoyed several meals here and all were outstanding and all reasonably priced.  The staff are lovely and very helpful.  There is also sufficient scope for vegetarians.

reviews.title: Really nice atmosphere and great food
reviews.text: Nine of us ate here and the food was outstanding. The staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Everyone had something different and no-one was disappointed. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: nice hotel
reviews.text: good clean hotel and amazing breakfast. Asked if they make some additional vegan food and they made it. Good service also.

reviews.title: Best place ever!!!
reviews.text: Honestly the hotel and the staff come next to none!!! I’ve been here now for the best part of three weeks and the service has never faulted once. The owner is personable and friendly and makes you feel like one of the family. The rooms are very stylish and comfortable with a favourite of room 25!!!  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and I come from a family of prudes so we aren’t nice about anyone!!!!

reviews.title: OH, MY!  We had a hard time justifying eating anywhere else! Interesting menu, even to those with food allergies!
reviews.text: The food was excellent!  Loved everything we ate. And we ate at Anna Casparii almost exclusively for 6 days. :0)

reviews.title: Seriously good food
reviews.text:
The restaurant is located on a picturesque spot in the harbor. But not where all the other restaurants are. So this might be the reason it attracts less visitors than you would expect once you have eaten here. 
The food is seriously good. I visit Harlingen frequently for my job and checked out several places. This is certainly my favorite. 
I started with a shrimp salad. Beautifully looking plate with fresh shrimps and a shrimp croquette accompanied with some nice salad and small asperges. As main course I took the cod. Large piece of fish cooked to perfection and again on a very nicely decorated plate with verifies and a delicate sauce. 
The service is nice and welcoming and I certainly will visit them again.

reviews.title: Atmosphere yes
reviews.text:
After a busy day out at Terschelling we had resisted dining on the ferry and thankfully so. Our meal at our hotel was lovely and nicely arranged. Not just a pub meal. The food was tasty and well cooked. A delightful end to the day.
Staff were friendly and you can see they care about their business.

reviews.title: two evenings, two fantastic meals
reviews.text: We were flabbergasted at how good was our oven-seared cod fillet dinner on our first night in Harlingen Harbour, so much so we went back the next night and were equally dazzled by the quality (and quantity!) of our plaice dinners ... had we stayed another night, we would have made it a hat-trick. Presentation was top-notch and the fish was perfectly cooked as were the fresh vegetables. Service was friendly but did not hover ... the dining room was spotless and well-appointed and the toilet facilities were also well-kept. They were both contenders for the best fish meal I've had the pleasure to enjoy. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Good food and friendly people
reviews.text: Even if it was past 9 pm they let me in to the restaurant. Had very nice monkfish. Prices are OK, nice place and friendly people.

photo.caption: Monkfish with salad and chips .. Yummy!

articleContent.title: Your go-to guide for dog-friendly travel

seoInfo.metaDescription: Traveling with your dog has never been easier—or more fun. Cities across the country boast pet-friendly hotels, parks, and activities. With CESAR® brand’s mission to make the world more pet-friendly and Tripadvisor’s top-rated spots, you can plan with confidence. Whether it’s a quick getaway or a bucket-list trip, our guides help you stay, play, and explore with your pup. Grab the leash and go!

articleContent.title: 5 perfect days in New York City

seoInfo.metaDescription: More than 60 million people visit New York City every year, and a huge percentage of them only hit the big sites—Times Square, the Empire State Building, etc. I get it: They’re iconic. But as someone who has lived in this city for more than 30 years, I’m here to tell you that you’re missing out if you don’t mix in some off-the-beaten path locations. Luckily, five days gives you plenty of time to do just that.

I’ve always loved train travel. There’s something special about settling into a window seat and watching the landscape drift past. And as a wheelchair user, that joy only grows when the journey feels easy: level boarding, space to move, and the kind of accessibility that lets you fully relax. For me, the best train rides—like weaving through the Tuscan countryside on Trenitalia—are never just a way to get from A to B; they're part of the adventure.
